full_text:
DEFINITIONS.

	For the purposes of this article, the following words and phrases are defined as follows:

	“Director” shall mean the Director of the Bureau of Street Maintenance

	“Private Street” shall mean a parcel of land not dedicated as a public street over which a private easement for road purposes has been granted to the owners of property contiguous or adjacent thereto which intersects or connects with a public street or another private street, and the instrument creating same has been duly recorded or filed in the office of the recorder of Los Angeles County.

1.name: Maintenance And Repair Of Hazardous Private Streets

14.catch_line: Failure To Comply With Order – Owner Loses Right To Repair After Department Of Public Works Has Begun Work.

15.catch_line: Costs To Be Assessed Against Property – When.

plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE

DEFINITIONS. (§ 65.02)

  DEFINITIONS.	For the purposes of this article, the following words and
phrases are defined as follows:	“Director” shall mean the Director of the
Bureau of Street Maintenance	“Private Street” shall mean a parcel of land
not dedicated as a public street over which a private easement for road purposes
has been granted to the owners of property contiguous or adjacent thereto which
intersects or connects with a public street or another private street, and the
instrument creating same has been duly recorded or filed in the office of the
recorder of Los Angeles County.

DEFINITIONS.

For the purposes of this article, the following words and phrases are defined as follows:

“Director” shall mean the Director of the Bureau of Street Maintenance

“Private Street” shall mean a parcel of land not dedicated as a public street over which a private easement for road purposes has been granted to the owners of property contiguous or adjacent thereto which intersects or connects with a public street or another private street, and the instrument creating same has been duly recorded or filed in the office of the recorder of Los Angeles County.
